items.label: rem-stratonovich-ito-equivalence
items.title: Relationship to It么 Formulation
items.content:
215: :label: rem-stratonovich-ito-equivalence
216: 
217: The equivalent It么 SDE includes a correction term:
218: 
219: $$
220: dv_t = \left[F(x_t) - \gamma(v_t - u(x_t)) + \underbrace{\frac{1}{2}\sum_{j=1}^d \Sigma_j(x_t,v_t) \cdot \nabla_v \Sigma_j(x_t,v_t)}_{\text{Stratonovich correction}}\right] dt + \Sigma(x_t,v_t) \, dW_t
221: 
222: $$
223: 
224: where $\Sigma_j$ is the $j$-th column of $\Sigma$.

items.label: rem-uniform-ellipticity-importance
items.title: Why Uniform Ellipticity Matters
items.content:
373: :label: rem-uniform-ellipticity-importance
374: 
375: The uniform ellipticity condition $\lambda_{\min} \geq \sigma_{\min}^2 > 0$ is **critical** for:
376: 
377: 1. **Ergodicity:** Ensures all velocity directions are explored
378: 2. **Hypocoercivity:** Allows diffusion in velocity to induce contraction in position
379: 3. **Coupling arguments:** Synchronous coupling between two swarms remains correlated

items.label: rem-formal-invariant-measure
items.title: Formal Invariant Measure (Without Boundary)
items.content:
466: :label: rem-formal-invariant-measure
467: 
468: On the **unbounded domain** $\mathbb{R}^d \times \mathbb{R}^d$ without the boundary condition, the Fokker-Planck equation admits the formal invariant density:
469: 
470: $$
471: \rho_{\infty}(x,v) \propto e^{-U(x) - \frac{1}{2\sigma_v^2/\gamma}\|v\|^2}
472: 
473: $$
474: 
475: This is the **canonical Gibbs distribution** for position and velocity.

items.label: unlabeled-remark-28
items.title: No Convexity Required
items.content:
1342: :class: important
1343: 
1344: **Critical clarification:** The hypocoercive contraction proven in this chapter uses **only**:
1345: 1. **Coercivity** of $U$ ({prf:ref}`axiom-confining-potential`) - confinement at infinity
1346: 2. **Lipschitz continuity** of forces on compact regions
1347: 3. **Friction-transport coupling** through the hypocoercive norm
1348: 4. **Non-degenerate noise** ({prf:ref}`axiom-diffusion-tensor`)
1349: 
1350: We do **NOT** assume:
1351: - Convexity of $U$ (monotonicity of forces)
1352: - Strong convexity (uniform lower bound on $\nabla^2 U$)
1353: - Dissipativity outside the boundary
1354: 
1355: The proof works for **W-shaped potentials**, **multi-well landscapes**, and any coercive potential. The effective contraction rate $\alpha_{\text{eff}}$ depends on $\min(\gamma, \alpha_U)$ but not on convexity moduli.

items.label: rem-coupling-term-intuition
items.title: Intuition for the Coupling Term
items.content:
1399: :label: rem-coupling-term-intuition
1400: 
1401: The coupling term $b\langle \Delta x, \Delta v \rangle$ is the key to hypocoercivity:
1402: 
1403: - **Without coupling** ($b = 0$): Position and velocity evolve independently in the norm. The degenerate noise in $v$ doesn't help regularize $x$.
1404: 
1405: - **With coupling** ($b \neq 0$): The cross term creates a "rotation" in the $(x,v)$ phase space. Even though noise only enters in $v$, the coupling allows dissipation to "leak" into the $x$ coordinate.
